title: The Hundred unveiled: Joe Root picked by Nottingham-based Trent Rockets with Ben Stokes set to play for Northern Superchargers
text:
England’s World Cup winners lined up to support the Hundred on Thursday as the first confirmed details of the competition were finally announced.

Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow will have to become accustomed to life away from Yorkshire after the franchise based at Headingley, the Northern Superchargers, chose Ben Stokes as their one pick from England’s Test contracted players.

Instead Root has been drafted by the Trent Rockets in Nottingham and Bairstow will play for the Welsh Fire in Cardiff.

Each of the eight teams were allowed to pick one centrally contracted Test star and two ‘local’ icons from England’s white ball players. The women’s teams could pick two contracted England players each.

The names of the franchises were also confirmed and the kits were made public for the first time. The tournament is being sponsored by KP Nuts and each team bears the logo of one of their brands with KP Nuts on the shirts of the Oval Invincibles, which should keep Kevin Pietersen happy, and Hula Hoops on the Western Fire. Chris Woakes was wearing a red and pink shirt with Butterkist popcorn emblazoned across the front as the icon player for the Birmingham Phoenix while England captains Eoin Morgan and Heather Knight will play at the Lord’s franchise, the London Spirit, sponsored by Tyrrell’s crisps, the suitably upmarket brand in the KP stable.
